headline.main: Think Like a Doctor: Running in Circles Solved!

docs.abstract: Dr. Lisa Sanders reveals the diagnosis in a mysterious case of an agitated young man with uncontrollable manic behavior.
docs.snippet: Dr. Lisa Sanders reveals the diagnosis in a mysterious case of an agitated young man with uncontrollable manic behavior.

docs.lead_paragraph: On an icy night in January, a man entered a grocery store here, walked past the displays of cake mix and paper towels, and went into the bathroom, where he injected himself with heroin.
docs.snippet: On an icy night in January, a man entered a grocery store here, walked past the displays of cake mix and paper towels, and went into the bathroom, where he injected himself with heroin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs are now temporarily on hold one day after going into effect in Arizona.

headline.main: Stay Granted for New Arizona Abortion-Drug Rules
headline.print_headline: Stay Granted for New Arizona Abortion-Drug Rules

docs.snippet: The nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs are now temporarily on hold one day after going into effect in Arizona.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court sided with abortion rights advocates on Tuesday in temporarily blocking Arizona from enforcing regulations that restrict access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses.

headline.main: Appeals Court Halts Enforcement of Arizona Abortion Drug Curbs
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Halts Enforcement of Arizona Abortion Drug Curbs

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court sided with abortion rights advocates on Tuesday in temporarily blocking Arizona from enforcing regulations that restrict access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses.

docs.lead_paragraph: The product, called Afrezza, would offer people with diabetes a treatment option that does not require injections, although its success in clinical trials has been modest at best.

headline.main: Inhaled Insulin Clears Hurdle Toward F.D.A. Approval
headline.print_headline: Inhaled Insulin Clears Hurdle Toward F.D.A. Approval

docs.abstract: Government advisory committee recommends that Food and Drug Administration approve form of insulin that is inhaled rather than injected; suggest that product, called Afrezza and developed by MannKind Corporation, will offer new treatment option for millions of Americans with diabetes.
docs.snippet: The product, called Afrezza, would offer people with diabetes a treatment option that does not require injections, although its success in clinical trials has been modest at best.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama Tuesday signed into law legislation to give doctors temporary relief from a flawed Medicare payment formula that threatened them with a 24 percent cut in their fees.

headline.main: Obama Signs Bill Temporarily Fixing Medicare Fees
headline.print_headline: Obama Signs Bill Temporarily Fixing Medicare Fees

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama Tuesday signed into law legislation to give doctors temporary relief from a flawed Medicare payment formula that threatened them with a 24 percent cut in their fees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Planned Parenthood Arizona filed an appeal Tuesday after a federal judge refused to temporarily block the nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Appeals Over New Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Appeals Over New Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: Planned Parenthood Arizona filed an appeal Tuesday after a federal judge refused to temporarily block the nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: What you need to know to start your day: Big Business grilled on the Hill, a White House victory lap, and an iBirthday.
docs.snippet: What you need to know to start your day: Big Business grilled on the Hill, a White House victory lap, and an iBirthday.

byline.original: By ADEEL HASSAN and VICTORIA SHANNON

docs.lead_paragraph: The rules, which were approved by the Arizona Legislature in 2012 and will take effect on Tuesday, restrict the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

headline.main: Judge Won’t Block Rules on Abortion Drug in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Judge Won’t Block Rules on Abortion Drug

docs.abstract: Federal Judge David C Bury refuses to block Arizona rules on limiting the use of abortion drugs; Planned Parenthood believes new restrictions will force many women to undergo unnecessary surgical abortions and prevent some women from getting an abortion at all.
docs.snippet: The rules, which were approved by the Arizona Legislature in 2012 and will take effect on Tuesday, restrict the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: After decades of focusing on aggressiveness, selfishness, narcissism and greed, scientists have turned their attention to the subtler theme of spite.
docs.abstract: Evolutionary theorists are beginning to study spite, or urge to punish or harm others, even at cost to oneself; Washington State University study in journal Psychological Assessment explores how behavior may lie at root of positive traits like cooperative spirit and sense of fair play.
docs.snippet: After decades of focusing on aggressiveness, selfishness, narcissism and greed, scientists have turned their attention to the subtler theme of spite.
